name: (1R)-3-Oxoindane-1-carboxylic acid
Reason: 1-oxoindane has a melting point of 106 degrees Celsius. The basic unit for our comparison will be benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5 degrees Celsius (according to the CRC Handbook of Chemistry and Physics, 49th Edition, 1968-1969). The structural modifications we need to consider are the presence of a methoxy group and a carboxylic acid. The methoxy group introduces additional rigidity and molecular weight, estimated at around +5 degrees Celsius. The carboxylic acid group introduces additional hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +10 degrees Celsius. The presence of a methoxy group and a carboxylic acid increases the melting point due to the potential for hydrogen bonding and dipole-dipole interactions, estimated at around +10 degrees Celsius.
